programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Children's food educator Beth Stephens hosts the first dinner party in Lowestoft, Suffolk, where she plans to impress her guests - caravan site owner Ray, beauty therapist Polly, housing officer Jonalt and ASBO officer Rachel - with locally sourced seasonal food. However, she and Rachel gang up on Ray for most of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following a group of elite bakers and sugarcraft specialists, beginning with a commission for a gravity-defying five-tier cake that will hang upside down.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A week of competitive holidaying begins in Betws-y-Coed, north Wales, where bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn welcome their fellow hoteliers to Llwyn Onn Guest House.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Durham compete to host the best dinner party, beginning with Steph and James, who offer a night of gastropub favourites. Day two sees animal-lovers Gary and Amanda serve up two courses of fish on their homely-menu, and hosts Andy and Emma feel confident on the final night of the competition.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry and Neil at Cashbrokers in Penzance look at an unusual red telephone box, and try to raise enough money on a Formula One memorabilia collection to keep someone's racing dreams alive. In London, Nathan and his assistant Debs have a close shave when valuing a mobile hairdressers and set about solving the mystery of an unusual handbag.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two sets of house-hunters - a couple who were moving into town and another who were set on leaving. In Surrey, Maeve and Peter were looking for a home in East Molesey, while in Hertfordshire Neil and Liz wanted to swap Watford for something closer to St Albans and Tring.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of house-hunters who had very specific search criteria. Sisters Gemma and Lucy wanted two of everything in their potential new home in Reading, Berkshire, including parking spaces, bathrooms and equal-sized bedrooms, and professional historical architects Colin and Robin had an exacting list of requirements for Phil in Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canal boat stewardess Denise Hendon hosts the first dinner party in Birmingham. Despite admitting her cookery skills could be better, she hopes her night of Moroccan-themed revelry will be a success, but the guests are underwhelmed by her menu. While party girl Angela McFarlane dreads eating the couscous, suave Frenchman Jean-Benoit Burloux longs for a glass of fine wine to wash the meal down.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Daniela Lawler throws the second party in Birmingham, hoping to impress her guests by inviting them to the Georgian country house she shares with her husband, DJ Steve Lawler. The hostess aims high by planning a four-course Italian-inspired meal, and everything seems to be going well, until she realises her lobster is too big to fit in her pans.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Office administrator Angela McFarlane hosts the third dinner party in Birmingham, and hopes to impress with a starter of chicken and spring onion terrine with red onion marmalade. However, the guests seem more interested in rummaging through her bedroom drawers.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Electrician Elliot Jauncey hosts the penultimate dinner party in Birmingham, and despite a lack of experience, plans a top-class menu featuring two desserts. He also books a local band to serenade his guests, but the evening turns out to be far more difficult than he had expected.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jean-Benoit Burloux hosts the final dinner party in Birmingham, and plans a four-course menu including crab in a bird's nest, a blade of beef and a pavlova with raspberries. However, the cook has to find a way of overcoming Denise's fussy eating habits before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Windsor, Vermont, on a mission to boost the fortunes of the Juniper Hill Inn, which may look impressive, but smells of raw sewage owing to a plumbing problem. After meeting the B&B's wealthy owner Robert Dean II, the chef uncovers some shocking treatment toward staff and realises he will need something approaching a miracle to save this business from disaster.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. He visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: Aidan Keane helps a school attendance officer convert her loft into a bedroom, study and en-suite for her daughter, and lends a hand to a builder renovating his own attic himself.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of house-hunters looking for homes in Yorkshire. Kate works in international development and has spent years in Africa and elsewhere around the globe. Now she wants to put down roots and has chosen the picturesque Yorkshire Dales. In nearby Leeds, perfectionist couple Charley and Hayley have spent nine months trying to clinch a deal on their first home, terrified of making the wrong decision. Can Kirstie and Phil help them both find what they're looking for?.(n)

programme.title: How to Live Mortgage Free with Sarah Beeny
programme.desc: Sarah visits a couple in Surrey who plan to use the sale of their houseboat to build a mortgage-free floating home to boost their pension, and Damion Burrows discovers how one man managed to live mortgage-free on some of the cheapest but most beautiful land in Scotland. Elsewhere, Sarah travels to the West Midlands and visits a couple who have built a cabin in a relative's garden.(n)

programme.title: Millionaires' Mansions: Designing Britain's Most Exclusive Homes
programme.desc: London's housing market is booming, thanks to foreign investors buying property worth more than £100billion - and as a result the luxury interior design industry is flourishing. This documentary follows prestigious designers working for some of the capital's wealthiest clients. They include Brian Wade, who has spent the past four-and-a-half years designing a seven-storey Knightsbridge townhouse, with furniture including a stingray-skin coffee table and a chandelier made from Hyde Park leaves dipped in gold.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with council housing officers in the London borough of Hounslow. Beverley has fallen behind with her rent and is facing eviction along with her 21-year-old son Zane, who has epilepsy, while Shane is living at his mother's with his three children and wants a home of his own, but a turn of events forces the council's hand when the case becomes more complex.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: The islanders face mother nature at her most violent and brutal, with a hurricane brewing 100 miles to the north, leaving the future of the community hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Karen and Jane are determined to set up their own splinter group and fend for themselves.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Four Sumatran orang-utans escape from their quarters, and tempting them back inside proves easier said than done, while the dominant female meerkat faces trouble from her daughter, who is launching physical attacks upon her mother. A young Asian elephant keeps the rest of the herd entertained as they adapt to the loss of two members to a virus. The keepers believe it needs a playmate its own age, but their hopes rest on the bull elephant mating with the females once more.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A one-year-old St Bernard suffering with hip dysplasia is brought to the clinic by the Warden family. Having recently lost the the dog's brother to a similar illness, emotions are running high. Meanwhile, Noel treats a 13-year-old Collie that has been hit by a car, and tries to devise a new bionic paw for a cat with a badly deformed hind foot.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Jenny's world begins to unravel as her dark secret is exposed, and as Sam comes face to face with his father, she finally begins to understand her son's true nature. Psychological thriller, starring Romola Garai and Jack Rowan, with Daniel Mays, Richard Coyle and Lara Peake.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Expensive Cars
programme.desc: Ant Anstead attends auctions in New York and California, while in the south of France, a car is up for sale that once belonged to actor James Mason.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food Bites
programme.sub-title: Jamie's Comfort Food: Steak and Onion Sandwich.
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a steak and onion sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Caravan park owner Ray hosts the second night in Lowestoft, where he hopes to win the £1,000 prize with a Spanish-themed evening, complete with a homemade tropical zone and an Ibiza-style club night in a barn - despite it being the middle of winter.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: Cornwall-based husband and wife Phil and Christine produce a five-foot long lemon and elderflower cake designed to look like a leaping fish.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are newlywed hoteliers Jon and Chelli Bean from The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton-on-Tees.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from south Wales compete to host the best dinner party and win the £1,000 prize, beginning with beautician Rachael and her partner Nick, who prepare a selection of dishes they've never made before. Dionne and Ameel prepare an Indian-inspired meal on the second night of the competition, before Angela and Jeff hope their no-nonsense menu can secure them the money.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London, Nathan hopes to do a big cash deal on some luxury handbags, while in Penzance, a collection of whisky, rare stamps and a red tractor arouse the dealers' interest.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with cautious first-time buyers Mark and Ellie Devine, who relocated from London to Bristol, and Jo and Pete in Archway, north London. With Jo's diagnosis of multiple sclerosis, easy access and a close proximity to transport links were vital considerations for Phil's original search brief.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp revisit house-hunters in Norfolk, first featured in January 2014. Young-at-heart pensioners John and Peggy were relocating from Derby to fulfil their dream of living by the sea - and with £450,000 to spend, they had an exacting list of criteria that had to be met. Meanwhile, Yvonne and Lisa from Leeds had reached the end of their tether after spending more than a year searching for a home in a rural district. A year on, how are both pairs getting on?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: National Heritage worker Gillian Sutherland hosts the first dinner party in Inverness, and has high hopes that her guests - emergency-call handler Melissa Kirby, property tycoon David Edes, hair stylist Zarina Ainslie and personal fitness trainer Jamie Tulloch - will appreciate her traditional Scottish menu.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Designer-label fan Melissa Kirby hosts the second dinner party in Inverness, hoping her cooking lessons from one of the city's best chefs will win her the £1,000 prize. However, rival Gillian is unimpressed when she finds out the chef also made the gravy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Property tycoon and teetotaller David Edes hosts a nautical evening for the third dinner party in Inverness, where his menu of `basic but wholesome food' makes his guests wary. A night of suspicion and hilarity between the diners ensues.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth night of the contest in Inverness, it is hairdresser Zarina Ainslie's turn to host. The fun-loving hopeful needs to live up to her lofty claims of being an amazing cook as her fellow contestants prepare to rate her on the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former professional footballer Jamie Tulloch hosts the final party in Inverness, going to the trouble of ensuring all the ingredients in his chosen dishes are locally sourced. However, it remains to be seen whether his home-grown approach to fine dining will be enough to impress his discerning fellow competitors, and as the night draws to a close, the week's winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues to uncover problems at the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vermont. The chef tries to help the staff communicate with owners Robert and Ari, but after he catches one of them telling a shocking lie, will it be the final straw?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.sub-title: Lake District and Scottish Highlands Revisits.
programme.desc: House-hunting show with Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer. The property experts catch up with two couples who hoped to realise dreams of finding a new home and business. Catherine and Mark wanted to move from the Midlands to the Lake District with plans to set up a hot-tub company, while Christine and Keith gave up life in Cambridgeshire to go in search of a hotel to run in the Highlands.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Costa Rica
programme.desc: Gaia Vince visits Central America's largest hydroelectric dam and the exclusion zone of an active volcano and discovers how Costa Rica has harnessed one of nature's most destructive forces to provide electricity. She also goes white-water rafting to a remote eco-lodge and helps to build artificial reefs from unlikely recycling materials.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Four Sumatran orang-utans escape from their quarters, and tempting them back inside proves easier said than done, while the dominant female meerkat faces trouble from her daughter, who is launching physical attacks upon her mother. A young Asian elephant keeps the rest of the herd entertained as they adapt to the loss of two members to a virus. The keepers believe it needs a playmate its own age, but their hopes rest on the bull elephant mating with the females once more.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A boxer dog is brought in with extensive injuries to its pelvis and hind legs from a road accident. Pioneering surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick considers a stem-cell scaffolding procedure - but there are significant risks attached. He and his team also help different animals with broken legs, including hedgehogs, and a kitten that has had an accident at home.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Caren and Dave head to the three-bedroomed bungalow of single mum Britta. She's a compulsive shopper who lives in the town of Everett in Washington state, where each of her rooms is packed with bargain buys, leftover food scraps and carpet stains. Have the British cleaners bitten off more than they can chew? Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Documentary examining British gang culture, revealing how drugs, criminal activity and violence have become part of members' everyday lives. programme.desc: Two talented drug cops who don't get along are framed by a powerful dealer and must work together to escape a prison controlled by the bad guy's minions and then get revenge on him(n)

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Comedy in which a millionaire and his spoilt and arrogant wife charter a yacht to take them and a group of friends from Greece to Italy. When she is unimpressed with her journey, the millionaire's wife takes her anger out on the crew, but the tables are turned when she is stranded on a desert island with one of the sailors(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: In this installment of the "Vacation" series, the youngest son of the Griswold clan, now grown with a family of his own, sets out to re-create a cross-country road trip from his youth to an amusement park(n)

programme.title: Tremors 3: Back to Perfection
programme.desc: Michael Gross stars in this thriller, which, like the original "Tremors," interjects humor with the creeps. It's been 11 years since Perfection, Nev., was infested with giant worms, and the town is now a tourist trap. However, another invasion looms. Bobby Jacoby, Charlotte Stewart, Tony Genaro, Ariana Richards, Shawn Christian, Mathew Seth Wilson(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: In this drama, a radiant 19-year-old American summers at an Italian villa to have her portrait done by a sculptor. During her stay, she looks for romance and also tries to learn the identity of her biological father. Gorgeous locations and lyrical cinematography add poetry to this sensual coming-of-age story(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A therapist travels to a distant space station to treat a group of astronauts traumatized by mysterious entities -- and ends up having to deal with an entity of his own -- in this second film version of Stanislaw Lem's philosophical sci-fi novel. Solaris stars George Clooney as Chris Kelvin, a psychologist still mourning the loss of his wife Rheya (Natascha McElhone) when he's implored by a colleague named Gibarian (Ulrich Tukur) to investigate the increasingly weird goings-on at the Prometheus space station. By the time Kelvin gets there, Gibarian has committed suicide, leaving only the cryptic, babbling Snow (Jeremy Davies) and the paranoid, guarded Gordon (Viola Davis), both of whom are holed up in their respective rooms. As Kelvin interrogates the skeleton crew, he learns that they've had unwanted "visitors," apparitions of long-dead friends, family, and loved ones who are apparently being generated by the interstellar energy source Solaris. The doctor is dubious of their claims until one night he, too, is greeted by his wife Rheya (Natascha McElhone), whose death still torments him. At first skeptical of the new Rheya, Kelvin gradually becomes obsessed with her -- and with the guilt that he feels over their troubled marriage -- to the point where the others begin to fear for his sanity. Produced by James Cameron, Solaris represented director Steven Soderbergh's first screenplay credit since the independently financed Schizopolis in 1996(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Action thriller about an anti-terrorist squad on an airborne mission to rescue a Washington-bound plane from hijackers armed with nerve gas. With millions of lives at stake and authorities anxious to shoot the plane down, a desperate mission is authorised to board and retake the plane in flight, but success depends on the skills of a desk-bound civil servant(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton (George Clooney) handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow "fixer" decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the center of a conspiratorial maelstrom. Once an ambitious D.A., Clayton is now a shell of his former dynamic self, thanks to a divorce, an unfortunate business venture, and astronomical debt. Though he longs to leave the cutthroat, ethically dubious world of corporate law behind, Clayton's poor financial situation and devotion to firm head Marty Bach (Sydney Pollack) leave him little choice but to remain on the job and tough it out. Meanwhile, litigator Karen Crowder (Tilda Swinton) finds her entire company's future hinging on the outcome of a multi-billion-dollar settlement overseen by Clayton's friend, star lawyer Arthur Edens (Tom Wilkinson). When Edens snaps and decides to blow the whistle on the questionable case, sabotaging the defense, Clayton must decide between his loyalty and his conscience(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Jennifer Eight
programme.desc: Ex-LA cop John Berlin moves to a small town and begins investigating a series of murders leading him to a blind woman who seems to be the key to the serial killer's next move(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Jim Carrey does an uncanny and eerie impersonation of quirky actor-comedian Andy Kaufman in this revealing biography directed by Milos Forman. Carrey is a revelation as he slides into Kaufman's most famous and infamous creations: "Tenk you beddy much" Foreign Man, who evolved into Latka on "Taxi"; lounge-singer Tony Clifton; and Andy the Wrestler. Courtney Love, Danny DeVito(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a pair of idiotic friends who set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner, unaware that it contains a large amount of ransom money for the owner's kidnapped husband. Their trip is fraught with disaster after hapless disaster, especially when the kidnapping crooks join the cross-country chase in pursuit of the cash(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson and Antonio Banderas make genial sparring buddies in this bright comedy-drama. They play pro boxers who are slightly over the hill, but have a chance to redeem their careers---if they fight against each other in a Las Vegas match. Lolita Davidovich, Lucy Liu, Tom Sizemore, Robert Wagner, Richard Masur. Directed by Ron Shelton ("Bull Durham")(n)

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: Jerry Zucker's fantasy stars Patrick Swayze as Sam Wheat and Demi Moore as Molly Jensen. He's killed in an apparently random mugging, leaving her heartbroken. But then it transpires that he was murdered to stop him exposing a major fraud - and this puts Molly in danger, because the incriminating information is in her possession. Sam's ghost, still earthbound, discovers the only way to warn her is through Oda Mae Brown, a fake medium who suddenly finds she's his channel to the living. A mix of comedy, thriller and romance (throwing a pot will never be the same again) coupled with outstanding special effects turned this into an enduring classic(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three romantically deprived women all find satisfaction in affairs with the same mysterious, charming stranger but slowly come to realize that this man may in fact be Satan himself. This popular fantasy drama features an all-star cast and a script based upon the best-selling novel by John Updike(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Robbie, the singer and Julia, the waitress are both engaged to be married but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Student Peter Parker develops superhuman strength after he's bitten by a laboratory spider. He starts to hit back against the school bullies, and then takes the fight against crime into the city(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The comic book web-slinger returns for a blockbusting sequel. Crimefighting has cost Peter Parker his best friend and his true love Mary Jane. But just as he quits as Spider-Man, New York comes under threat from Dr Octopus, a metal-tentacled madman. Peter has no choice but to swing back into action(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: After he is sent to remote Alaska to track down an elusive child murderer, a city detective becomes the subject of blackmail and sleep-depriving mind games(n)

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: In this audacious ensemble drama about the intersecting lives of troubled Californians, a dying mogul tries to reunite with his motivational-speaker son, a young quiz-show winner deals with his father's abuse and a drug addict falls for a lonely cop(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Ghost in the Machine.
programme.desc: Undercover detective John Campbell is shot dead while investigating an illegal international trade in stolen luxury car parts. Laura and the team quickly make an arrest, only to find a photograph of Campbell in the suspected killer's possession that could only have been obtained from an apparently secure police computer. It transpires that other police files have also been hacked and circulated to the wider world, so the team sets out to find the hacker responsible. Debra Messing stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the double murder of a wealthy man and his daughter, and the evidence leads them to suspect the wife and stepmother of the deceased are guilty.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A girl is killed in a crime displaying all the hallmarks of white supremacists who recruit teenagers to carry out acts of violence, and the team races to bring the ringleader to justice before more youngsters are butchered. Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom and Riley investigate a double fatality at a street party in Las Vegas's Korean district. Evidence links the victims to a criminal organisation known for its connections to the vice industry. However, a discovery at the crime scene sheds new light on the case, and sets the team off in search of a youngster who may be the killer's next target. Starring William Petersen and Lauren Lee Smith.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team delves into Vance's troubled past in a desperate effort to trap a vengeful female assassin named Lee Wuan Kai. Although she is determined to strike back at him by targeting his family, it gradually transpires that there is another deeper motive for her crimes. Crime drama, guest starring Kelly Hu, with Mark Harmon, Rocky Carroll and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Dov shoots and kills a man during a robbery, but during the subsequent investigation into the incident he begins to question whether he acted rashly. When news of the death hits the streets, 15 Division struggles to prevent a riot. On the day of a streetball tournament, Frank relies on an ex-convict to tell him whether any trouble is brewing. Crime drama, starring Gregory Smith.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Dark Heart.
programme.desc: When a body turns up bearing the hallmarks of St Valentine, a mass murderer who was shot dead 20 years before, the police attribute the crime to a committed copycat, and it is believed that the deceased's girlfriend may be in grave danger. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A respected financial analyst dies from an overdose of Viagra, a drug he was advised not to take. The subsequent investigation uncovers foul play involving his mistress (guest star Julia Roberts) and an unscrupulous tycoon, whose attorneys thwart McCoy and Carmichael's attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A sound-system installer is murdered after supplying goods to a strip club covertly operated by the Mafia, and the finger of blame points to a small-time hoodlum whose crime boss father is serving life imprisonment. The case eventually comes to trial - but investigators are disturbed to hear an untrustworthy government attorney is handling the prosecution. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.desc: The return of the crime drama. Evidence leads Mac and the team to arsonist Leonard Brooks, who has just been released from prison after serving 15 years. Rob Morrow (Numb3rs) guest stars, with Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate a government organisation dedicated to child prodigies while researching the death of a marine whose body appeared in the middle of a field disguised as a scarecrow, and realise a 12-year-old could be the killer's next target. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The marine son of a colonel-turned-preacher is found dead in woodlands after changing his religious persuasion. As the case unfolds, it becomes apparent to the agents that he could have been the victim of a hate crime. Meanwhile, Gibbs' father visits for the holidays. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. DiNozzo, McGee and the FBI continue to track political connections to a case, and Bishop sends DiNozzo a souvenir. Meanwhile, Gibbs and Special Agent Pride chase leads in New Orleans after evidence points to a copycat killer. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The body of a badly beaten youth is found in the luggage compartment on an airport shuttle bus, leading investigators to make further grisly discoveries as a paedophile ring is exposed. Subsequent inquiries lead them to a travel agency specialising in exotic trips for sexual predators. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The decomposing body of a five-year-old girl is found, leading to the revelation that a homicidal paedophile is on the loose. The subsequent disappearance of a second youngster leads to a race against time to save her from a similar fate. Gritty drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Newspaper columnist Jimmy MacArthur is given full access to the squad for an inside look at the New York Police Department. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Danny Pino and Ice-T.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and Stella look into the death of an estate agent whose body was found in an unoccupied property near Central Park. Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Second spin-off from the Crime Scene Investigation series, starring Gary Sinise as an investigator tackling crime around the seamy side of New York City. With Carmine Giovinazzo and Hill Harper.(n)

programme.desc: A fire at an illicit nightclub leads to the deaths of 53 revellers, and the subsequent investigation prompts the detectives to question an arsonist who unwittingly reveals his involvement in an illegal immigrant racket.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is discovered during a city-wide power cut - and because Jethro and the team are unable to use their modern electronic equipment, they have to solve the case the old-fashioned way, and it soon becomes apparent that national security could be at stake. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: A man's body is recovered after a car full of women leaving a bachelorette party crashes into his parked vehicle, only for Jerry to discover he was murdered before the crash. Chris realises he still has feelings for Gail as they interview the witnesses, while Traci and Andy discover the bride is hiding a secret that could shed light on the victim's mysterious death. Crime drama, starring Noam Jenkins and Travis Milne.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Political Operation.
programme.desc: Jake and Laura are put on security detail for a forward-thinking Cuban politician, whose visit to the United States leads to the tragic death of his protector.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pregnant student is found murdered, and detectives Briscoe and Curtis discover she was strangled to death before being stabbed by the killer in an effort to make the attack seem like the random act of a psychopath. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. A shootout between a motorist and the police leads to the discovery of a body in a car boot - and puts the detectives on the trail of a money-laundering operation run by Russian gangsters. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Sniper
programme.desc: Thomas Beckett, a tough, grizzled, U.S. Marine Corps veteran sharpshooter who is assigned to assassinate a Panamanian rebel bankrolled by a drug cartel in his bid for the presidency. His assigned partner is raw recruit Richard Miller, a former Olympic marksmanwho has never actually killed anybody, but who technically outranks the more experienced Beckett. That is a source of friction between the men as they make their way through the jungle to find their prey. Once they locate their target, Beckett and Miller not only have to pull off a complex shooting but also must avoid a covert shooter who was once trained by Beckett, but has now switched sides. The new partners must quickly learn to work together and complete the mission, hindered by numerous enemy patrols, the renegade American working for the enemy, "El Cirujano"- a mysterious sniper, and the jungle itself, in Panamanian director Luis Llosa's fast-paced, military thriller(n)

programme.desc: First entry in the action-thriller series that teamed Mel Gibson and Danny Glover as a seemingly psychotic cop and his common-sense family-man partner, respectively. In this outing, they investigate a woman's plunge from a high-rise and its connection to a drug cartel(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this affectionate remake of the British classic as Charlie Croker, who, after taking over from John Bridger as the leader of a gang of thieves, celebrates his new status with a multi-million-dollar job in Venice. But gang member Steve Frezelli double-crosses his friends, kills Bridger and leaves the rest for dead. The gang survive and Croker spends a year tracking the traitor, using the safecracking skills of Bridger's daughter Stella to rob Steve and avenge her father's death. F Gary Gray's all-action movie does, of course, include the famous Minis sequence, with several of the cast doing their own driving(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: Mel Gibson reprises his role as the post-apocalyptic drifter. Max is asked to help a community to protect their oil supply from a vicious bike gang(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames(n)

programme.title: Never Die Alone
programme.desc: Rapper-turned-actor DMX is chilling in this intense account of the life and death of a violent drug kingpin. Flashbacks chronicle the life of King David (DMX), who turns out to be more like Goliath when he is knifed by a gangster's young henchman (Michael Ealy). David Arquette costars as an aspiring writer, who inherits audiotapes that detail all of King David's nasty business dealings. Clifton Powell(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: A mother and her young daughter, who are trying to start a new life for themselves, move in to a spooky, dilapidated apartment. When a mysterious damp patch on the ceiling grows and her daughter starts talking of an imaginary friend, she begins to wonder whether supernatural forces are at work. Remake of a 2002 Japanese film of the same name(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: An isolated desert town is menaced from underneath by gigantic mutant worms in this horror-comedy, which captures the fun spirit of 1950s drive-in monster movies, only with improved production values. As the worms begin killing off the residents one by one, two handymen become the town's only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: Body Parts
programme.desc: A psychologist injured in a car accident receives an arm transplant from a serial killer. He believes he is being partially possessed and must fight to reclaim control over his body before he kills someone(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: When their regular babysitter can't make it, two suburban parents hire her friend "Anna" (Sarah Bolger) to look after their three children while they enjoy a night out. But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: High-octane action ignites this slick car-chase thriller. Retired master car thief Randall "Memphis" Raines (Nicolas Cage) is pulled back into the business when a crime lord threatens to kill his brother. To save his sibling, Raines assembles a crew of carjackers to help him steal 50 top-model cars within 72 hours(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power
programme.desc: In this belated prequel to director Brian De Palma's 1993 crime drama, gangster Carlito Brigante (Jay Hernandez) rises through the ranks of the New York underworld to establish himself as Spanish Harlem's most powerful kingpin. As the intoxication of ultimate power tightens its firm grip on the rising heroin czar, he soon learns that greed and deception are the unspoken laws of the street. With no one to trust except for his two brothers in crime, Carlito begins building an empire founded on supplying the city's addicts with the one product that is always in demand. His dreams of ruling the city finally becoming a reality, Carlito soon learns that the only way to sustain his power is through loyalty and respect. Adapted from author Edwin Torres' acclaimed novel, Carlito's Way: Rise to Power also stars Mario Van Peebles, Luis Guzmán, and Sean Combs(n)

Plus, musical guests Gorillaz perform We Got the Power. Providing there is time, the host will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Heart Is a Small Thing.
programme.desc: Matteo wants to prove his marriage is over, but a face from the past brings up painful memories of his life before Holby. Meanwhile, Dominic struggles with his first day back on Keller when a deceitful patient reminds him of his traumatic relationship with Isaac. And when Bernie's son Cameron returns, Morven must finally confront her feelings for him.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: Mark Gatiss, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith explore Victoria Wood's take on television. Clips include banal TV presenters Marjorie and Joan and Sally and Martin, Acorn Antiques and a pastiche of a 1960's episode of Coronation Street. The hosts also look at Victoria's pioneering mockumentaries.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: Daniel Rigby looks back at Victoria Wood's life on screen and the memorable moments she created on the topic of fame. Clips include her performances on That's Life, sketches from Wood & Walters, and As Seen On TV. There is also footage from Acorn Antiques and contributions from Julie Walters, Mark Gatiss, Michael Ball and Maxine Peake. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Football Abuse: The Ugly Side of the Beautiful Game
programme.desc: Reporter Mark Daly explores fresh allegations of a cover-up connected to a notorious paedophile scandal that rocked the youth football circuit in Scotland in the past. He also hears accounts from former footballers who talk for the first time about the abuse they allegedly suffered as boys in the sport.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation has called stress the `health epidemic of the 21st century', and it has been blamed for contributing to illnesses such as diabetes, dementia and types of cancer. Here, Fiona Phillips explores scientific research into stress and demonstrates a number of techniques designed to decrease common factors. She also investigates whether it is inherently a bad thing, joining a number of volunteers who put themselves into a number of high-stress situations to truly understand its meaning and how people could use it to their advantage.(n)

programme.title: My Life in Books
programme.desc: Anne Robinson welcomes two celebrity guests to discuss their favourite books. Crime novelist PD James and radio presenter Richard Bacon talk about the publications that have shaped their lives, from popular childhood reads to those that have inspired their careers.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich head to Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, where they face an oddly shaped backyard with an assortment of random levels and surfaces.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Danny Sebastian Showdown.
programme.desc: Antiques experts Jonty Hearnden and Danny Sebastian race towards the finish line at the showdown auction in London. Jonty finds a pair of valuable chairs in the back of a van, and Danny tries his luck on a Tantalus once owned by Danny La Rue.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Senate House in Bloomsbury, Britain's oldest skyscraper and administrative centre of the University of London. Items under valuation include the hoof of a horse that fought in the Battle of Balaclava, a collection of stained glass panels that were recovered from a skip, and a diamond and platinum bracelet.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Athletics

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver heads to the north Atlantic to visit the Faroe Islands, where he learns how romance blossomed between British soldiers and local women during the Second World War's `Operation Valentine'.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A dog that keeps barking results in a neighbour dispute. Meanwhile, Sharon confronts schoolgirl Rachel about her relationship with Brian, but is later badly beaten by drug dealers.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Brian is treated like a hero for saving Sharon from the drug dealers. An Asian girl goes missing after being entered into an arranged marriage.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Multi-millionaire landowner Paul Lister's plan to turn his 23,000-acre estate north of Inverness into Europe's first wilderness reserve, reinstating Caledonian pine forests and releasing animals including moose, wild boar and brown bears. However, foot and mouth, red tape and local opposition threaten his dream.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and James Braxton embark on a new road trip, beginning in Boston, Lincolnshire, before ending at their first auction in the Norfolk town of Fakenham.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a special celebrity edition of the show as sports commentators Iwan Thomas, Martine Wright, Tania Nadarajah, Sean Rose and Steve Brown compete.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Phil Tufnell, Michael Buerk and Naga Munchetty use their knowledge and debating skills to help contestant Liz to win the big cash prize. Hosted by Irish comedian Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West chefs Dominic Chapman, Tom Brown and Andy Clatworthy go all out to impress with their starters. Returning chef Dominic serves up a complex summer salad, while newcomer Tom worries his elegant dish may fail to impress the veteran judge, and Andy hopes his mushroom-centred dish will secure his place at the banquet.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates more unusual natural events, including a mysterious mass die-off of saiga antelope in Kazakhstan, strange holes ripped out of the clouds and the real reason for a long line of pits carved out of the Peruvian desert. He charts the advance of a crab army in Norwegian waters, finds out what is killing off seabirds on remote islands and why spiders are glowing in the dark. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti travel more than 120 miles north of the Arctic Circle into Swedish Lapland to work in Icehotel in the village of Jukkasjarvi. Using two-ton blocks of ice hacked from the nearby River Torne, Giles works with a team of international artists to create individually crafted rooms and is taught how to make drinking glasses from ice, while Monica learns how the head chef uses natural ingredients found in the nearby forest; and meets Manne, an 82-year-old man who supplies reindeer meat to the hotel. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe, Romesh Ranganathan and Ed Gamble join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis and Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: Love is in the air at La Banditaccia, as the group prepare to host their first big event on the farm, a traditional Italian wedding. Faced with the language barrier and different cultural traditions, they find themselves under a great deal of pressure to make sure they get everything right for this very special occasion. As the wedding day dawns, the group faces the challenge of preparing a feast of authentic Tuscan cuisine, hoping to impress a party of 40 discerning Italian guests.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition, only the 14 best cooks remain, and the battle is on as they come together for the first time and cook off against each other across two shows. They are split into two groups, with the seven members of the blue team first to cook as they are given 90 minutes to create a dish inspired by family favourites or food from their childhoods.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits Warwickshire for Hedgehog Awareness Week, and meets three girls who have set up a rehab centre for the animals. Steve Brown meets local volunteers trying to preserve wildlife along the river Tame and its floodplain, and John Craven visits a nature reserve that doubles as a burial ground. Adam Henson meets a farming family in Cumbria and Tom Heap explores Scotland's salmon industry.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at the Royal Mansour in Marrakesh, Morocco, which was built by royal decree to showcase the region to world leaders, as well as billionaires and celebrity guests. Monica works with executive housekeeper Laurence, who shows her each of the 350 pairs of curtains must be caressed by hand to create perfect pleats, while Giles dons the uniform of the hotel butlers as he is introduced him to the hotel's underground tunnels, which ensure absolute discretion to the guests.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Kate Bliss Vs Caroline Hawley Car Boot.
programme.desc: Antiques experts Kate Bliss and Caroline Hawley go head to head at a London car boot sale, where Caroline comes across some school chairs from the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bent's Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The latest from the General Election campaign trail, interspersed with interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn and Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest fixtures, including Warrington Wolves v St Helens, Catalans Dragons v Leeds Rhinos and Wigan Warriors v Salford Red Devils.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt is out on the Humber estuary, while Julia discovers a rich wildlife breeding ground.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Sean and Adrian are involved in a traffic incident that escalates with tragic consequences, while a stag night prank gets out of hand.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Katie has news that could split the Kiely family in two, Brian tries to get Sharon to leave and the results of Gerard Curry's post-mortem are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore what Britons ate during wartime and discover how some of the UK's favourite dishes have evolved from rationing. The duo also meet army cooks to find out what troops on the front line eat today, and prepare rabbit stew and carrot cake.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Spectacled Bears - Shadows of the Forest.
programme.desc: An insight into the endangered spectacled bears that live in reduced numbers in Peru, and about which little was known until recent years when zoologists were forced to reassess their preconception of them as gentle, vegetarian creatures. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneer Charlie Ross and James Braxton start in the Lincolnshire town of Stamford, then travel around Norfolk before ending up at an auction in St Ives, Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Consumer journalists Jasmine Birtles, Chris Hollins, Simon Calder, Adam Pearson and Rebecca Wilcox compete in a charity edition hosted by Jeremy Vine.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty asks the questions as John Sergeant, Liz Carr and June Sarpong try and help solicitor Paul from Manchester walk away with a jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The South West heats continue with the fish course, and Tom Brown, Head Chef at Outlaw's at The Capital in Knightsbridge, is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet. Meanwhile, his competitors, Andy Clatworthy and Dominic Chapman, are looking to score highly with their more luxurious dishes.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Two teams battle it out for the last two semi-final places. For the miniature challenge, judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin ask the teams to create 72 designer viennoiserie, and 72 rolled petit fours. Then the teams construct towering chocolate showpieces, along with 108 moulded chocolate bon bons using The Sky at Night as their inspiration. The two top scorers will make it through to the semi-finals, but the team with the lowest tally at the end of the two days must leave the competition. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group enjoy their last few days together on the La Banditaccia farm, before reflecting on what they have learnt about themselves during their stay, and saying their final goodbyes. There's a chance of a lifetime on the horizon for one member of the group, while others reach some surprising conclusions about their future in Italy.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes grime star Stormzy, who returns to the show following his acclaimed debut in 2014. Graham Gouldman's art rockers 10cc make their debut, while New Orleans-based musician Benjamin Booker looks set to boost his fanbase with second album Witness. Norwegian singer-songwriter Sigrid also performs her debut single, Don't Kill My Vibe. Making their inaugural appearances on Later are Kentucky singer-songwriter Joan Shelley and Canadian duo Japandroids.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Dara and Ed's Road to Mandalay
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain and Ed Byrne explore South East Asia, travelling more than 3,000 miles from Malaysia to Myanmar as they forge their way to the historic city of Mandalay. The comedians begin their journey in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur, where they watch a beauty pageant for chickens and join a mass cycle ride through the city.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade on the Silk Road
programme.desc: Documentary series focusing on the traditional crafts along the ancient trade route of the Silk Road, capturing the techniques used by master craftsmen at work. The first edition is set in North West China, where the Uyghur community has been making Atlas silk for thousands of years. It follows a weaver, Mattursun Islam, and his family as they continue the tradition and produce silk in over 200 designs in a small workshop.(n)

programme.title: Mud, Sweat and Tractors: The Story of Agriculture
programme.desc: Exploring man's relationship with the land, charting the revolution that food production in Britain underwent in the 20th century and examining the impact this had on the lives of farmers and consumers alike. The first programme features the home movies of two dairy farmers from the south of England and looks at the changing ways in which milk was distributed and sold.(n)

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudi.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Story of Marie Antoinette's Watch with Nicholas Parsons
programme.desc: The Just a Minute host explores the life and work of Swiss horologist Abraham-Louis Breguet and goes in search of his most famous timepiece, which is valued at up to $100m.(n)

programme.title: Michael Palin's Quest for Artemisia
programme.desc: The Monty Python star sets off on a quest to investigate the story of little-known 17th-century Italian artist Artemisia Gentileschi after one of her paintings caught his eye. Michael encounters her work in Florence, Rome and Naples, and finds out about her life as a working mother and her ultimate success against all odds as a great painter of the Baroque age who transformed the way women were depicted in art, and who was sought after in many courts across Europe.(n)

programme.title: Harlots, Housewives & Heroines: A 17th Century History for Girls
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the domestic lives of women in Restoration England. She explains how marital status was seen as a defining factor in determining a woman's worth, with those who fell outside the accepted norms often becoming social outcasts. However, she also discovers a surprising number of women began to question society's expectations of them - particularly in terms of bearing children.(n)

programme.title: Botany: A Blooming History
programme.desc: Timothy Walker explains why the process of photosynthesis in plants is vital to the survival of life on Earth, and traces how the research of 17th-century botanists provided the foundations for scientists to discover the link between sunlight and plant growth. He also examines modern-day attempts to artificially replicate the process, and meets those hoping that photosynthesis could provide a solution to the world's fuel supply problems.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: In the late 1960s, motorways opened Britain up to a huge range of travel opportunities with the offer of comfort, glamour and speed. In the early years service stations were destinations and the journey a matter of ritual. The mass colonisation of the countryside and the focus on commercial traffic has changed all that, as planner Peter Hall and author Will Self discuss.(n)

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudi.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade on the Silk Road
programme.desc: The documentary series follows Shavkat Jumanijozov, who has been working with wood in Khiva, Uzbekistan for over 30 years, producing carved doors, chests and wooden pillars that are displayed and sold across the world. The programme captures the creation of a two metre wooden column, from the first cuts into the wood, to its carving, sanding, shaping and varnishing, and Shavkat explains how he hand built his own hotel and trained over 30 local apprentices in the art of woodcarving.(n)

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest 2017
programme.sub-title: Eurovision Song Contest Semi-Final: Semi Final One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mel Giedroyc and Scott Mills report from Kiev in Ukraine for the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest. As 18 acts battle it out for a place in the 62nd annual competition on May 13, the UK's entry Lucie Jones chats to the hosts about all things Eurovision.(n)

programme.title: Joy of Abba
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how pop group Abba raised the bar for their music genre in the 1970s and early 80s, popularising the sound of Swedish melancholy. The programme explores how the quartet of Agnetha Faltskog, Bjorn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson and Anni-Frid Lyngstad came to dominate the British music charts with simple, catchy melodies, but also divided opinion due to the populist sheen of their output.(n)

programme.title: Rome's Lost Empire
programme.desc: Dan Snow uses the latest satellite technology to reveal the secrets of ancient Rome. Teaming up with archaeologist Sarah Parcak, the presenter sets out to identify and then track down lost cities, amphitheatres and forts in an adventure that sees him travel through some of the most spectacular parts of the vast empire.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 613. programme.desc: Episode 509. programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will makes a poor business decision and ditches many of his loyal clients after realising wealthy businessman Harlin Polk provides 90 per cent of his custom. Meanwhile, Grace helps shopaholic Karen stick to a budget imposed by her husband.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Jack challenges Will to join his staff as a waiter, but the lawyer tries to back out when he has to serve a few old faces. Grace is amazed to discover Karen once appeared in an adult film and sets out to retrieve all 50 copies distributed across Manhattan to put her friend's mind at rest.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray keeps visiting Robert's new apartment, which always seems to be swarming with pretty girls - until Debra puts in an appearance and curtails his enthusiasm. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The spirit of Christmas is in short supply when Ray gives his parents a personalised toaster and they sneak off to exchange it for a coffee machine. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is shocked to discover his father let him win a game of table tennis when he was 12, and indignantly demands a rematch, determined to secure a legitimate victory this time. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A recurring dream makes Frasier wonder whether he is gay, prompting him to search for a more reassuring explanation - with a little help from Niles. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. Comedy, guest starring Robert Prosky (Hill Street Blues), with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to Essex, where they rescue a 1974 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray that has been off the road for years. However, they soon discover it may be a bigger job than they anticipated when they get the iconic US vehicle back to the workshop.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. He visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick in London, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick set their sights on an emerald ring, and an Abraham Lincoln plaque that was buried under a house in Poland. In Sheffield, Dan is doing deals on a vintage Bakelite radio, luxury boots and a posh bag.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Brighton couple Guy and Julie Sadler search for a home in Almeria, Spain, on a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: Molly Robbins makes a celebration cake for a flamboyant customer to help him celebrate 35 years as a drag artist, complete with 50 edible peacock feathers and 3,000 gold flowers.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge offers to babysit Ned Flanders' boys so he can attend a left-handers' convention. Meanwhile, Homer takes the Simpson children to an animal retirement home - where Bart has the misfortune to be kidnapped by a lonely chimpanzee.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darcy makes Adam question whether he should marry Maxine, and Simone is floored when Cindy announces that she is running against her for the local councillor position. Meanwhile, Hunter leaves his risque drawings of Neeta on her desk.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.sub-title: Trump, The Doctor & the Vaccine Scandal: Channel 4 Dispatches.
programme.desc: Cathy Newman reveals the role played by the disgraced British doctor Andrew Wakefield, who was struck off by the GMC seven years ago, in Donald Trump's administration. She asks whether the President's opinions on autism have been shaped by Wakefield's views on the topic.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: New series. Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as our national dish. Kate Quilton looks into where multivitamins come from and how much we need them, while Matt Tebbutt visits the UK's leading clotted cream producer in Cornwall and an astonishing algae farm in the desert in Israel.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: The islanders face mother nature at her most violent and brutal, with a hurricane brewing 100 miles to the north, leaving the future of the community hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Karen and Jane are determined to set up their own splinter group and fend for themselves.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: New series. Following the sale of their company Idyl Hands and its hit mobile phone game Cat Factory, friends and business partners Josh, Leon, Watto and Ewan wake up to the realisation that they are now multimillionaires - but the company is almost immediately hit by a lawsuit. Comedy drama, starring Nick Helm, Jim Howick, Samuel Anderson and Jonny Sweet.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including E4's Tattoo Artist of the Year, Antiques Roadshow, The Supervet, Britain's Got Talent, The Island with Bear Grylls, Speed and the News. As usual, the programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Grimebusters Sandra and Carly travel to the United States, where they tackle the homes of 51-year-old former builder Will, from Gordonsville, Virginia. He has obsessive compulsive personality disorder, which has led to a shopping addiction, causing his apartment to be stuffed with internet purchases. The duo have their work cut out as he also owns a mansion house in the centre of town that's also heaving with junk.(n)

programme.title: Never Seen a Doctor
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets people who have been avoiding their health troubles and hiding from the doctor and dentist for years. They include Leicestershire couple Janice and Greg, who have serious dental issues, while in Scotland, Joanne is stuck in a never-ending cycle with her psoriasis. Will she give up her current life with friends and family to try something new?.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton meets Richard Southgate and his wife Katie as they build a five-bedroom family home in the Shropshire countryside. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: The title of Transporter of the Week is still up for grabs, so with a hand-built rowing boat already on board, Dave and Jenny take on a side-load. Meanwhile, after a money-saving night in a truckstop, Bev and Graham head out to collect a second caravan.(n)

programme.title: The Speaking Hand: Zakir Hussain and the Art of the Indian Drum
programme.desc: Premiere. Director Sumantra Ghosal's documentary charts the growth of Zakir Hussain, the greatest living exponent of the tabla drums, through a series of concerts and interviews.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: The duo arrange a coming-out party for Jack, hoping it will give him the opportunity he needs to tell his mother he is gay - but she surprises them by revealing a secret of her own.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will receives an unexpected job offer from a lawyer who refused to pay Grace for her interior design services. Jack teams up with Karen to make a sexual harassment video. Comedy, guest starring Gregory Hines.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is angry to learn Ray threw a party in her house 20 years previously, and responds by spurning him in favour of Robert. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Doris Roberts and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert's new girlfriend causes problems with the Barones, who begin to question his motives for seeing her. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Ray are asked to film a video tribute to Frank, who has been named Man of the Year at his lodge, but find none of the other members can stand him.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles hits the airwaves as a stand-in during Frasier's absence from his radio show, but gets more than he bargained for thanks to a star basketball player. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne is dumped by her boyfriend and causes bemusement in the Crane household by immediately embarking on a new relationship - with a man who looks, dresses, talks and acts exactly like Niles. Comedy, starring Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw, master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and a team of experts head to Eastbourne in East Sussex to take on an iconic French front-wheel drive car. The vehicle in question is a 1954 Citroen Traction Avant belonging to former watchmaker and classic car lover Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.desc: In Sheffield, boss Dan and shop manager Ellie look at a stunning collection of jewellery, an upmarket watch with a hefty price tag and a vintage arcade boxing machine. At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and Debbs consider doing a deal on a rare Victorian military helmet.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Best friends and godsisters Roselyn Fleary and Jennifer Lawrence search for a holiday home on the Caribbean island of Grenada that could one day become a retirement location.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, two guests are damning about the breakfast quality, so it remains to be seen how managers Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks will react.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: Michelle Wibowo creates a five-foot edible Wizard of Oz mural out of Genoese sponge, while Nastassja Lusengo decorates one of her red velvet cakes in edible gold leaf.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: We're on the Road to D'ohwhere.
programme.desc: Homer is forced to drive Bart to a discipline camp in another state, meaning he has to miss out on a trip to Las Vegas with Moe and the gang. While they are away, Marge decides to hold a yard sale - but ends up getting arrested as a suspected drug dealer.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter and Prince are shocked when their dad Shane return, and Tegan gives Nick an ultimatum about their relationship. Elsewhere, Zack's romantic surprise ends in a trip to the hospital when he suffers an allergic reaction.(n)

programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Caren and Dave head to the three-bedroomed bungalow of single mum Britta. Have the British cleaners bitten off more than they can chew? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Being unable to control her labour heightens first-time mum Natasha's anxiety, while Erika and Jez, a couple who struggled to conceive prepare for their second baby. And after Emma was given the all-clear from a cervical cancer diagnosis, she and partner James decided to lose 11 stone between them to give themselves the best chance of starting a family.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Welsh beauty therapist Eve meets rugby-loving teaching assistant and compatriot Jordan. She has alopecia and has never been on a night out without her wig, but a head tattoo generates a great reaction. Meanwhile, model Jade wows her fellow daters as she walks into the restaurant, but can business owner Adam live up to this tall, blonde single mum's exacting standards for the whole evening?.(n)

programme.title: Confessions of a Junior Doctor
programme.desc: This episode follows the junior doctors looking after Northampton General's youngest, and often most fragile, patients in the paediatric department. Third-year doctor Fahim takes his first steps onto the children's wards, working week after week of night shifts in the neo-natal unit, caring for premature babies and those born with acute illnesses. The stressful environment takes its toll on Fahim, who begins to wonder if he really is cut out to look after such delicate and difficult patients.(n)
