Meanwhile, Adil tries to break ties with Lucian after giving him more information gleaned from Toby's briefcase and the situation takes a serious turn when MI5 officers arrive at the Halcyon with a warrant to enter and search the premises - prompting Freddie to return to deal with the ensuing crisis.(n)

programme.title: Harlots
programme.desc: Margaret is desperate to find North and Jacob, while Charlotte and Marney plan their future, but all three Wells women fear they will come under suspicion when a discovery is made.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: The queen becomes pregnant, and declares that Albert will become head of state in the event of her death. The developments outrage members of the Tory party, who fear a German prince holding sway over the nation and make arrangements to disrupt his visit to the industrial north. The consort finds an unlikely ally in Sir Robert Peel, who seeks royal approval for the rapidly developing railway. At first, Victoria does not approve, but soon changes her mind when she experiences Peel's creation for herself.(n)

programme.desc: Hardy faces a race against time as Ellie discovers a startling new piece of evidence, forcing them to reassess their suspicions. programme.desc: Former policeman Robert and his wife Katy gave up their city lives after a witness in his care was shot dead, and he's been struggling with his guilt ever since. But when old colleague DCI Mark Maxwell suggests the building would work as a safe house, Robert takes in a family whose members are under threat. It's a chance for him to make use of his detective skills and ensure nothing goes wrong this time. Drama, starring Christopher Eccleston, Marsha Thomason and Paterson Joseph.(n)

It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?.(n)

programme.desc: Special documentary on one of the greatest coaches in Manchester United history, the man who brought through legendary names like Duncan Edwards and Sir Bobby Charlton.(n)

programme.title: Dennis Viollet: A United Man
programme.desc: The story of prolific striker and United legend Dennis Viollet. He was part of the Busby Babes team and a Munich Air Disaster survivor. Viollett played a massive role in the development in the USA.(n)

programme.title: Europa League Highlights

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Melvyn and Patricia Whitton five properties in Orlando, Florida. They have £180,000 to spend on a five-bedroom house for holidays in the sun, where they plan to invite their three daughters and eight grandchildren to join them.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Steven Weald and Sue Upson search for a winter home north of Naples on Florida's Gulf Coast, and shows the active couple five properties that are within their £150,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The sports car-themed PitStop in Hertfordshire hosts the first round, as owners Melvyn and Sindy Rutter try to make a good impression. However, the absence of tea and coffee in the rooms does not go down well with the guests, and Melvyn's after-dinner talk about his collection of Morgan cars fails to spark much interest.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill and Peter Tydie invite their fellow competitors to stay at the Victory in Mersea, Essex, a four-star B&B with 26 members of staff to run the bar, restaurant and accommodation. A trip to a local fishery gives one contestant an opportunity to annoy his peers, and the discovery of a hole in a bedsheet leaves the hosts feeling uneasy about their chances of success.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave Botha hosts at his Butterfly Paragliding B&B on the Isle of Wight. Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham are unhappy they must sleep in a tepee in the garden and use an outdoor toilet, and claim they were served watery eggs and rubbery sausages for breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham host the final night at Braddon Hall in Torquay, Devon, where Melvyn and Sindy take issue with their squeaky four-poster bed. The hoteliers try to entertain their guests by inviting them to take part in an archery contest - which ends in accusations of unfair play.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. One of the hosts gets upset about large underpayments and a couple interrogate their guests about the criticism in their feedback, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and sports fishing enthusiast Ian Walls from Edinburgh has decided to expand his property portfolio by purchasing a place on Grand Bahama where he can spend a couple of months every winter. With his US-based girlfriend Lisa on hand to offer a second opinion, Sara Damergi shows them a selection of homes for sale around his £111,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps George and Gillian Pook search for a holiday home and a property they can eventually retire to on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast, and shows them places she hopes will be suitable within their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson gets to choose a site for investigation and decides to take the team to Jersey, where a German anti-aircraft battery was built during the Second World War. As the experts explore the area, they realise it contained a large and complex settlement, and discover shocking facts about the islanders' suffering during the war.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for Roman artefacts beneath the graveyard of St Kyneburgha's Church in Castor, Cambridgeshire. With several reports of similar finds in and around the village, speculation mounts that they could uncover the remnants of a praetorium - a huge building that would have dominated the region's skyline during the period. However, as the experts start digging in other nearby locations, they discover that not all the evidence points to the same conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller and his team deal with an exotic dog with a tricky past, a bulldog in need of a new home and some wild kittens with worms.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Four-Year-Olds
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the world of 10 four-year-olds as they meet in a nursery rigged with cameras that capture every glance, whisper, tussle and emotion. With their parents watching on monitors, the children encounter one another for the first time in October and then again in May. Overseeing the action are two experts - educational neuroscientist Paul Howard-Jones and developmental psychologist Sam Wass - as the youngsters make and break friendships, and find their place in this new social group.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: GP Peter Berkin and his wife Chard, an alternative medicine practitioner, have decided to build a new home at the bottom of their garden, but cannot agree on any part of the design - even the basic shape. Peter is a keen hobbyist who wants the house to feature a workshop where he can build a plane, and he's planning to spend twice the £200,000 budget Chard has in mind. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Britain by Drone
programme.desc: Tony Robinson presents the first of two programmes using drones to shoot aerial footage of areas of Britain that are off limits to the public. Among the locations featured is a village on Salisbury Plain that is not listed on any maps, and is used by the military for training. The drones record an exercise involving tanks storming the area. Other sites include the world's most advanced container port, a Second World War bunker, an abandoned airbase that once housed nuclear weapons, and an 18th-century mansion belonging to a Russian billionaire.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 71-year-old woman is rushed in after being knocked over by her husband's car, and her blood pressure has dropped critically low. Four-year-old Maddi is brought in with an injured neck after falling over on a train, and doctors worry that metal plates she already had in her neck may have shifted, causing damage to her spine. Plus, 68-year-old Bonnie arrives after hitting her head on her bedside table.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This one-off edition of the programme looks at the challenges facing Cheshire's police custody teams, with around 20,000 people passing through their cells every year. Homeless ex-serviceman and repeat offender Michael has been arrested following a complaint about his behaviour in a cinema, but he is just happy to have a roof over his head for the night, while DC Ben Hilton is called out to deal with a case of a woman who has been arrested after stabbing her partner in the leg with a kitchen knife.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 71-year-old woman is rushed in after being knocked over by her husband's car, and her blood pressure has dropped critically low. Four-year-old Maddi is brought in with an injured neck after falling over on a train, and doctors worry that metal plates she already had in her neck may have shifted, causing damage to her spine. Plus, 68-year-old Bonnie arrives after hitting her head on her bedside table.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This one-off edition of the programme looks at the challenges facing Cheshire's police custody teams, with around 20,000 people passing through their cells every year. Homeless ex-serviceman and repeat offender Michael has been arrested following a complaint about his behaviour in a cinema, but he is just happy to have a roof over his head for the night, while DC Ben Hilton is called out to deal with a case of a woman who has been arrested after stabbing her partner in the leg with a kitchen knife.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by actor Henry Winkler, comedians Henning Wehn and Romesh Ranganathan, and Olympic swimmer Rebecca Adlington. As usual, the panellists discuss and dissect the events that have set the British public's chins wagging over the past week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and sports fishing enthusiast Ian Walls from Edinburgh has decided to expand his property portfolio by purchasing a place on Grand Bahama where he can spend a couple of months every winter. With his US-based girlfriend Lisa on hand to offer a second opinion, Sara Damergi shows them a selection of homes for sale around his £111,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps George and Gillian Pook search for a holiday home and a property they can eventually retire to on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast, and shows them places she hopes will be suitable within their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and Shirley Boyle, owners of the Old Hall Country House in Madeley, Cheshire, host the week's first round of the B&B competition. The guests are impressed by the 16th-century building, and are taken tap-dancing and to a private fine-dining restaurant, but one of them is dissatisfied with her bedroom's layout and the garnish on her eggs at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are the third hosts, at their three-bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, Cornwall. For the activity they arrange a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. Some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room but the food is a success, and Eileen Finn demonstrates her karate skills on the men.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Cavendish in Bournemouth, run by Tim and Karen Sturgess. On arrival, the competitors are impressed by the `pink palace', but things go downhill when a bed is broken and one couple are allocated a room next to the front door. However, Eileen is delighted by the feline memorabilia in her room and the group enjoys a spot of indoor paint-balling and an open-top bus tour of the resort.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is surprised by an overpayment and Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley receives tough criticism, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Having both retired from the Army, Rachel and Steven Grey are hoping to find the perfect property on Costa Rica's Pacific Costa Ballena where they can run a small B&B. Sara Damergi shows them a variety of possible options for their £250,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps mother and daughter Laura and Leah Wright spend a recent inheritance on finding a holiday home on Spain's Orihuela Costa.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Manor Moat.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts head to Llancaiach Fawr Manor, near Caerphilly, south Wales, to investigate an ancient moat. The team's geophysicists feel the site should provide them with the ideal conditions to determine what the ditch was originally designed to guard - but the project soon becomes one of the most baffling investigations in the programme's history.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Derwentcote in Co Durham, where they explore the Industrial Revolution's impact on the region by digging through the undergrowth to search for old furnaces and forges. Their investigation is also helped by the diary of an 18th-century industrial spy, and records from the time help shed light on how the area's cottage industries gave way to the power of expanding cities such as Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends a parakeet with a broken leg and a much-loved cat that needs its thyroid gland removed, while the vet's own puppy is rushed in after swallowing a baby's dummy.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of 4 Year Olds.
programme.desc: Documentary, following up on the previous stand-alone film The Secret Life of Four-Year-Olds, which detailed the uncensored dramas of life in a typical nursery. Filmed over the course of a single summer, the series explores the lives of three groups of children, aged four, five and six, as they meet for the first time. The experiment begins with an introduction to the four-year-old group, which includes forthright would-be leader Tia, boistrous boys Nathaniel and Jack, and sociable Theo, who is determined to befriend the somewhat introverted Tyler - whether he likes it or not.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Tracy Fox and husband Steve want to build an `urban shed' featuring two studios, three bedrooms and a double-height space with a walkway, made out of industrial-style materials including corrugated cement fibreboard and 20ft panels of polycarbonate sheeting. Having discovered an old milk yard tucked away behind some flats and shops in south-east London, their long-held desire to build a highly unconventional family home and workspace begins. But their choice of unorthodox materials proves challenging and costly. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three Hampshire homeowners seek inspiration in each other's houses, then have a week and £1,500 to make changes before buyer Isla and her mum Samia turn up for a viewing.(n)

programme.title: UK's Best Place to Live
programme.desc: Sarah Beeny reveals the United Kingdom's most desirable place to live. With the help of analysis of key factors, she travels around the UK looking for good affordable housing, best job prospects, reasonable child care, quality of family life and of social life. At the end of the show she reveals which location scores best.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Le Bistro in Lighthouse Point, Florida, where the stubborn chef and owner has lost his passion for cooking. The visiting expert hopes to help, but his criticisms are not well received, causing tempers to flare.(n)

programme.desc: Cindy Crawford's Beauty Secrets! Cindy's Targeted Beauty Trio is new for 2017! Rediscover your skin's youthful radiance. This new offer is free to you as part of Meaningful Beauty ULTRA! That's 3 free gifts and free shipping today!(n)

programme.title: 42 Ways to Kill Hitler
programme.desc: Over sixty years after the end of World War II, recently declassified documents and contemporary experiments offer insight into a multitude of attempts at assassinating one of the most feared and despised dictators of the 20th Century. As the Nazi war machine spread terror and death across Europe, there were at least forty-two documented plots to kill Adolf Hitler and bring his regime crumbling to the ground. But who were the men that offered to lay their own lives on the line for the sake of killing one of history's most despised tyrants, and just how did they plan on accomplishing such a formidable feat? In this documentary, the filmmakers at National Geographic offer detailed insight into the forty-two assassination plots that may have altered the course of history had they actually succeeded(n)

programme.desc: Documentary charting in detail the events leading up to the killing of Stacey Mackie in January 2012. Stacey ended her friendship with Terrence Armer, who became abusive and threatening, culminating in his gaining entry to her flat, dousing her in white spirit and setting her alight. The programme features interviews with Stacey's mother and sister and a detective inspector from Cumbria police force, as well as expert analysis from a criminal psychologist.(n)

After a close friend nominates them for the DIY SOS treatment, Nick and the team - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - turn up to transform it into a home they can enjoy as a family, now and in the future.(n)

programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander follow a semi-detached houses in Kent and Surrey to auction, along with a three-bedroom terrace in Stoke-on-Trent. They also meet the people who bought the properties, and find out what they paid when they went under the hammer.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman undertakes a house hunt in North Yorkshire for two keen walkers, hoping to find their dream home with a budget of £400,000. She also learns more about England's oldest horse race, the Kiplingcotes Derby.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS Special: The Losers Show.
programme.desc: A team of experts help amateurs whose projects have gone horribly wrong, while Lowri Turner and Nick Knowles find out how life has treated some of the DIY bodgers encountered over the course of three years.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team race against the clock to renovate a living room before bride-to-be Saarb's family arrives for the wedding. Groom Ty had big plans for the room, and even he is surprised by the mess he has made. Meanwhile, Lowri Turner hears the pleas of three more DIY incompetents, including a man who has been working on his kitchen for four years.(n)

programme.title: RIP Files
programme.desc: The Research and Investigation of the Paranormal - or RIP team as it more commonly known - visits a prison in Virginia that is overflowing with lingering spirits.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin arrive in Wickenburg, Arizona, where several fatal mining accidents occurred during the 19th century.(n)

programme.title: Animal SOS
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of RSPCA officers across the country as they try to rescue pets and wildlife from harm, and give them better lives.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman undertakes a house hunt in North Yorkshire for two keen walkers, hoping to find their dream home with a budget of £400,000. She also learns more about England's oldest horse race, the Kiplingcotes Derby.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Epsom.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Epsom to meet paramedics Sam and Ben Laws, who have two children, one with special needs. The couple already find it hard, working opposite shifts which mean they often don't see each other for days on end - and to make matters worse, they have found their house to be inadequate for their requirements. After a close friend nominates them for the DIY SOS treatment, Nick and the team - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - turn up to transform it into a home they can enjoy as a family, now and in the future.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Cutting-edge documentary series following the Staffordshire Police force as they fight crime in the country's diverse and contrasting communities.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux's LA Stories
programme.desc: California has some of the toughest regulations controlling sex offenders anywhere in America - after leaving prison they can spend years on parole being tagged and tracked and a lifetime on an online register. In his final film exploring different aspects of life in Los Angeles, Louis Theroux visits hostels to talk to parolees as well as the people charged with monitoring them, and asks whether the restrictions keep society safer and when, if ever, it is right to give sex offenders a second chance.(n)

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill
programme.desc: At every hospital Charles Cullen worked, the death rates increased substantially. The male nurse was later revealed as the most prolific serial killer in New Jersey history, and was suspected of being the most prolific in American history. He confessed to killing up to 40 patients during the course of his 16-year career, but his victim count is believed to total as many as 300 people.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team finds a body in the boot of a stolen vehicle during an investigation into a group of car thieves. However, the victim is difficult to identify because his fingertips have been sanded down and his face is wrapped up in bandages because he recently underwent plastic surgery. Crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett accompanies Jenna Kaye to North Korea, where her fiance is being held hostage by rebels. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigates the murder of a journalist, before uncovering a clue that links the victim to Jenna. Crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff members worry about the health of a newborn monkey, while infant orang-utan Dinda gets to grips with the outside enclosure, and stump-tailed macaque Koko has difficulties with her living accommodation.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The life of a baby woolly monkey hangs in the balance just 24 hours after its birth and Charlie is bullied by other chimps, meaning his days of living in the bachelor group could be numbered.(n)

programme.desc: Animal behaviour expert Victoria Stilwell helps desperate pet owners control their misbehaving dogs, starting with glamour model Jodie Marsh and her problem puppies, including bulldogs Paddy and Lyla who are bullied by her four Chihuahuas.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Teal'c, Carter and Daniel return to Stargate Command, where they report a mysterious fifth member of SG-1 is trapped on the planet with Jack - a story that Hammond views with suspicion. Sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dean Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Relic Hunter
programme.desc: Nigel's kidnapping by shady government agent Derek Lloyd sparks a terrifying mission to New Guinea. Action adventure, starring Tia Carrere and Christien Anholt.(n)

programme.title: Farscape
programme.desc: Crichton locks the rest of the crew in the cells and poses as a Peacekeeper captain to deal with an approaching commando ship, but Rygel and Chiana inadvertently release a deadly invisible agent. Sci-fi drama, with Ben Browder.(n)

programme.title: Police 10/7
programme.desc: Following the work of police officers in New Zealand, featuring behind-the-scenes access to cases and revealing new information about high profile crimes. Hosted and narrated by Detective Sergeant Rob Lemoto.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Freemasons
programme.desc: Members reveal why they joined the brotherhood, while the Bedford lodge hosts its annual ladies' night and a new music-themed branch opens in south Wales.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan Thinking Aloud
programme.desc: The comedian tackles another of the big questions that keep him awake at night, with this edition focusing on the issue of the midlife crisis.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: The actor and his documentary team expose stories of crime and hardship around the world, beginning with sex trafficking in India. Ross visits the notorious red-light district of Mumbai, where secretly filmed footage reveals not only the scale of the industry but how young some of the girls trapped in it are. He also travels across country to West Bengal, meeting families whose daughters have been taken from them, and comes face to face with a sex trafficker who confesses to many shocking acts that leave the presenter and his team stunned.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Ben Fogle presents the documentary exploring the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out how destructive high-speed winds can be through a series of spectacular reconstructions.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank has to deal with a political scandal when insensitive comments made by his father Henry are illegally recorded and leaked to the press. Meanwhile, Jamie is called in to intervene in a case of domestic abuse and ends up the target of a thug bent on vengeance. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.sub-title: In the Shadow of The Gunmen - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Secret Service are put on high alert in the wake of an assassination attempt that leaves some victims fighting for their lives - including President Bartlet himself. Martin Sheen stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.sub-title: In the Shadow of Two Gunmen - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Josh reminisces while under the anaesthetic, recalling how Leo, Sam, CJ and Donna became members of the political team as well as events leading up to Bartlet's nomination for president. The police continue to search for the remaining conspirator. Martin Sheen stars.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the case of a murdered Puerto Rican assistant district attorney. Investigating his links to a scandal involving a large sum of money, she discovers the victim was a prosecutor in a murder trial, and renewed suspicion falls on the defendant. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A legendary jazz musician who believes he has a fatal brain disease is brought into the hospital with pneumonia and signs a form to ensure he is not resuscitated. However, House insists that the diagnosis is incorrect and administers treatment without consent - leading to a furious confrontation with the authorities. Guest starring R'n'B singer Brandy.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank and Danny work together to put away an international criminal who has repeatedly managed to avoid a string of murder charges, but finding the evidence they need to secure a conviction is no easy feat. Meanwhile, Erin considers going into private practice when she realises just how much Nicky's education is going to cost. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg and Bridget Moynahan.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House staff recover from the assassination attempt and prepare for the mid-term congressional elections, President Bartlet gets sidetracked by a former rival's campaign for a school board seat in New Hampshire and Sam talks an old friend into running for office. Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet shocks the team by ordering the hiring of a Republican and Toby gets involved in negotiating an agreement between the leader of an Aids-ravaged African nation and a drug company. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush is called in to investigate a 1978 suicide case in which a cult member was believed to have committed suicide. programme.title: House
programme.desc: A homeless woman's worsening symptoms baffle Dr House and the team, who struggle to identify her condition - a task made more difficult by the fact she is unable to tell them her name. They finally make a diagnosis, but quickly need to find a mystery man known only as James before the patient dies. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie, with Robert Sean Leonard and Jesse Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank faces a public backlash after an officer's body camera malfunctions during an altercation with a civilian, and Danny and Baez struggle to protect an informant after the US Marshals Service decides not to put him in witness protection. Erin also has a tricky time when she investigates a claim of rape by the daughter of an old friend. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg and Bridget Moynahan.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven, while in the north of Westeros at Castle Black, the Night's Watch stands behind Alliser Thorne. Fantasy drama, starring Isaac Hempstead-Wright and Owen Teale.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: An overtired Richard pushes himself to extreme levels working on his new idea, and perpetually unlucky-in-love Dinesh gets a hot date.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.title: Real Time with Bill Maher
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Maher invites three guests from different parts of the political spectrum to discuss the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
programme.desc: Documentary charting the relationship between entertainer Debbie Reynolds and her actress daughter Carrie Fisher, who died within a day of each other in December 2016.(n)

programme.title: The Borgias
programme.desc: Charles and the French army begin their invasion of Italy, but their brutal methods leave della Rovere questioning whether he has made the right choice. Rodrigo seeks the counsel of an old friend, Lucrezia worries she may soon be forced to share her bed with husband Giovanni, and Juan continues his affair with Sancia. Historical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, with Gina McKee (Our Friends in the North).(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: The return of the comedy following the exploits of four twenty-something Brooklyn women. Reeling after a nasty run-in with Natalia at Ray's new coffee and pizza place, Hannah and a reluctant Adam host a dinner at their apartment for Marnie, who is living at home in New Jersey, and Shoshanna, who is alternating nights of sexual freedom with academia after splitting with Ray. Meanwhile, Jessa's new friend Jasper (Richard E Grant) highlights the issues she has with her father. Starring Lena Dunham, Allison Williams, Zosia Mamet and Jemima Kirke.(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: Hannah, Shoshanna and Adam go on a road trip to reunite with Jessa, leaving Marnie feeling left out as she moves into her own place. On the trip, Hannah searches in vain for writing inspiration in order to meet her editor's deadline. Comedy, starring Lena Dunham, Allison Williams, Zosia Mamet and Jemima Kirke.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates the balance of power in Rome and discovers how the city has been affected by the end of Silvio Berlusconi's government. He also explores the influence of organised crime in the Italian capital and speaks to journalist Myrta Merlino, fashion designer and politician Santo Versace and Pietro Grasso, the head of the city's anti-Mafia crime unit.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat visits Los Angeles to investigate how America's entertainment industry is faring in the 21st century, and meets Ron Meyer, president of Universal Studios. He also explores the city's vast social and economic divides, and discovers how homelessness and gang culture affect its residents.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.sub-title: And It's Surely to Their Credit.
programme.desc: Ainsley's welcome at the White House is muted, Sam considers suing the hate group responsible for shooting Josh and CJ confronts a general threatening to criticise the President about cuts in the military budget. Meanwhile, Abby informs her husband that his recovery period is over, which should allow him to resume a full and active married life.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet considers recalling the Senate in order to force a vote on a nuclear test-ban treaty, and also has to deal with a drunken Ukrainian diplomat who insists on meeting him. Donna and the secretaries have their own mission - to persuade their bosses to back legislation which would introduce ergonomic standards into the workplace. Drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A referee makes a shocking confession on his deathbed, prompting Rush and the team to revisit the case of an amateur boxer who died in 1976 after suffering a defeat in a fight against a more experienced opponent. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris and Danny Pino.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor is given the case of a car-crash victim still suffering from internal bleeding three weeks after the accident. Initial attempts to make a diagnosis are hampered by House's struggle to cope without his own pain medication after Cuddy bets him he cannot give it up for a week. But before long the patient takes a turn for the worse, and the medic is forced to find the cause of his failing liver. With Hugh Laurie and Lisa Edelstein.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the murders of three prominent community leaders, while Frank meets a group determined to ensure the incidents are treated seriously. Elsewhere, Danny and Linda clash when she decides she wants to carry a gun after being mugged. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. programme.desc: In La Mancha, Steve and Rob dress the part as Don Quixote and Sancho Panza, before treading the boards at the Corral de Comedias.(n)
